page.title: 12 A THORLEY COMMUTER
page.content: The Thorley area of Bishop's Stortford has become a dormitory suburb for London.One commuter moved to Thorley from Manchester in 1984.He is a Fleet Street journalist working for The Express.When he started commuting to London he drove to Epping,parked at the station & went by underground train. This cost 420p per day plus petrol and took half an hour longer than his present journey.Now when he is on day shift his wife drives him to the station at 7.30am.A day return costs 730p but it is not always worthwhile buying a 2400p weekly ticket because sometimes he only has to travel to work on 2 days a week.If he is on night shift he drives all the way via the M11 He finds commuting expensive & sometimes frustrating when Fleet Street buses & Liverpool Street trains are late.
